title: Logos for me
content:
Hello everyone,

I’m in my first year graphic & typographic design at KABK, and I’m working on a project which is to develop my own logo.

I want it to have a very actual look, yet with a good sense of tradition. Nimble yet sturdy.

I found the Silom a quite appropriate typeface, very ’electronic’ but quite round.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811070235im_/http:/typophile.com/files/medwarsig_5481.jpg)

What do you think of it?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [medwarsig.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811070235/http:/typophile.com/files/medwarsig.jpg) | 106.87 KB |

 [‹ children's theater](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811070235/http:/typophile.com/node/19722 "Go to previous forum topic") [Victorian(?) style logo for small web/dtp business ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811070235/http:/typophile.com/node/19648 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Ringo

comments.content: It says the jpg file contains errors, I’m guessing it’s a CMYK jpg. You’ll need to convert to RGB to fix the error.

Assuming it is supposed to read – me dwarsig – it isn’t working, specifically the z just doesn’t read s to me, I can just about buy e=a and m=w. I don’t understand the significance of the rz in merz but the rotation/reflection falls down because the r won’t let you do that. I don’t know if you could find a better typeface, but I suspect a simple monoline would perform better something like [Variable](http://web.archive.org/web/20070811070235/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/madtype/variable/). As it stands I am not getting any sturdy tradition, let alone nimbleness.  
Tim

Assuming it is supposed to read – me dwarsig – it isn’t working, specifically the z just doesn’t read s to me, I can just about buy e=a and m=w. Readability isn’t my first command but it mustn’t be a puzzle too hard to solve. I enjoy experimenting with rotated/reflected letter images: to what extent does it affect the readability, is there a possibility of letter exchanges (e=a, m=w etc) without getting too... fuzzy, if you know what i mean. I don’t understand the significance of the rz in merz but the rotation/reflection falls down because the r won’t let you do that.
 Just a little Merz joke.
I don’t know if you could find a better typeface, but I suspect a simple monoline would perform better something like Variable. As it stands I am not getting any sturdy tradition, let alone nimbleness.
 Hmm i keep on trying. Thx. :)
